definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: There is corkage fee for brought in liquors.
sentences.chinese: 自帶酒水是要收開瓶費的。

sentences.english: Some restaurants allow you to take your own wine and just charge you corkage.
sentences.chinese: 有些餐廳允許顧客自帶酒水，只收些開瓶費。

sentences.english: There is no corkage fee for brought in liquors.
sentences.chinese: 自帶酒水是不收開瓶費的。

sentences.english: Consumers can no longer feel free to say"No"to corkage fees charged by restaurants.
sentences.chinese: 以後消費者不能隨便拒付餐館提出的開瓶費了。
